name: @ash@acegiak.net
note: Gameplay & Narrative Designer, Writer, Occasional Streamer, Anarchoqueer, and Goblin Queen.

content.html: This week's #ProjectWeirdLittleGuy #ScreenshotSaturday update is: Spawn clusters! It's nothing fancy, but it really helps make world generation more believable and fun to explore? It's just a kind of subtable in my spawn/loot table system, but with min and max number of spawns per cluster and a radius. I've also added things like a loading bar and a failed attempt at terrain LOD but they don't quite screenshot as well
content.value: This week's #ProjectWeirdLittleGuy #ScreenshotSaturday update is: Spawn clusters! It's nothing fancy, but it really helps make world generation more believable and fun to explore? It's just a kind of subtable in my spawn/loot table system, but with min and max number of spawns per cluster and a radius. I've also added things like a loading bar and a failed attempt at terrain LOD but they don't quite screenshot as well  😅

photo.alt: A weird little guy explores part of their desert world but stones and bushes appear in clusters rather than spread by pure random distribution.

content.html: I know I'm an old lady now because I feel fancy when I get to spend money on good tools like Miro or GitKraken.

content.html: Am... am I the only one feeling like there's been way more murdered trans women than usual in the last three weeks or so?

content.html:
Man I love Valheim but I wish the devs would put absolutely any game design thought at all into any of the systems that aren't straight lifted from other games. There are so many pain points that read as "we didn't think about this beyond using whatever we'd seen elsewhere."

Any time a game is described as "hard core" or "brutal" or "losing is fun" in the marketing and community messaging I feel like it's just code for "there are really obvious shitty pain points in our design and we don't have the skills to fix them."
content.value:

content.html:
If you want to help trans people, and you work in tech: think about how your product handles names and genders. Can users change them? Is it a self-service? Do traces of the old name remain?

Then, fix it. Push back against resistance. Advocate for us.

It won't fix bigotry, or healthcare access, or w/e. But updating our details is a process full of hurdles that we have to go through at a really vulnerable point in our lives, and you can make a small improvement for a large number of us.
content.value: If you want to help trans people, and you work in tech: think about how your product handles names and genders. Can users change them? Is it a self-service? Do traces of the old name remain?Then, fix it. Push back against resistance. Advocate for us.It won't fix bigotry, or healthcare access, or w/e. But updating our details is a process full of hurdles that we have to go through at a really vulnerable point in our lives, and you can make a small improvement for a large number of us.

That same musk lorikeet with its tail spread to dry better.
